comments:
Exception is thrown when trying to load the amd64 version of 
libswt-mozilla-gtk-3062.so:  
 
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 Aug 17, 2004 00:47:24.127 
!MESSAGE no swt-mozilla-gtk-3062 in java.library.path 
!STACK 0 
java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no swt-mozilla-gtk-3062 in java.library.path 
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary(ClassLoader.java:1670) 
        at java.lang.Runtime.loadLibrary0(Runtime.java:821) 
        at java.lang.System.loadLibrary(System.java:991) 
        at org.eclipse.swt.internal.Library.loadLibrary(Library.java:100) 
        at org.eclipse.swt.browser.Browser.<init>(Browser.java:119) 
... 
 
I am running on the 3.0 eclipse release, under SuSE 9.1 x86_64 with Sun's 
JDK1.5Beta2.  
 
It appears the library is missing from the release distribution:  
 
eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.swt.gtk64_3.0.0/os/linux/amd64/libswt-mozilla-gtk-3062.so

In 3.0, there is no support for the Browser widget on AMD 64.  However, the 
failure should not be UnSatisfiedLinkError but rather SWT.Error "No More 
Handles".  Christophe to comment.

The exception I get is the expected one. In Eclipse 3.0, the Browser correctly
throws an SWTError No more handles wrapping the unsatisfied link error.
Jonathan, do you see the SWTError as well in your log?

swt-mozilla-gtk-3062 in java.library.path) 
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2717) 
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2616) 
        at org.eclipse.swt.browser.Browser.<init>(Browser.java:122) 
 
Does this mean there will be no support for the Browser widget under AMD64? 
Should I revert to the 32bit version?

Trying to get a 64 bit build of Mozilla for AMD64. Apparently there are some 
special patches to apply on top of the Mozilla source tree.

fixed v>20041123
Browser widget using Mozilla 64 bit build provided as an early access.

Mozilla is not officially supported on 64 bit platforms at the moment. 
Distributions apparently provide patches on top of the existing source code 
and it is expected that recent versions of Mozilla will work better than older 
ones. 
On that platform, I am currently running and compiling using a mozilla source 
tree from Mozilla 1.7 GTK2 as provided from the gentoo distribution (2004.2). 
This should be considered early access as a result. Users are recommended to 
use Mozilla 1.7GTK2 builds on AMD64.
